intro: Melampyrum roseum var. setaceum, commonly known as the pink touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pink to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The species is known for its unique seed dispersal mechanism, where the seed pods explosively release seeds upon touch.
